channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+2833] The 5 Minute Decision that Saved the World in 1983
item.description: In 1983, Stanislav Petrov held a very important station: He was incharge of monitoring the Soviet Union’s satellites over the UnitedStates, and watching for any sign of military action. According to thesystem, the United States had launched five missiles and the U.S.S.R. was under attack.

item.title: [+1750] Family Guy: Then and Now (PIC)
[+1590] Programmers are tiny gods [Pic]
[+1456] Full Toy Story 3 Trailer Online Now!
item.description: The first full trailer for Toy Story 3 is, at long last, online right now. It’s beautiful. Not just visually but emotionally. It’s been in theaters for a couple of weeks, in full 3D, but this is your first chance to see it online. Yes, it’s in 2D of course. You won’t need that extra pair of glasses.

item.title: [+1444] Drives On What Side? [PIC]
[+1332] Hidden Camera Prank Goes Very Wrong (Video)
item.description: Well, it goes very wrong for the prankster and oh so very right for us. Never prank someone near a karate master.

item.title: [+841] Illegal Downloads 150x More Profitable Than Legal Sales
item.description: Unlike most people might think, piracy is not necessarily a bad thing for copyright holders. In fact, German pirate-tracking outfit DigiRights Solutions shows that copyright holders can earn 150 times more money from illicit downloads than from iTunes and other legal stores.

item.title: [+827] Ubuntu 9.10 - Almost Perfect
item.description: Ubuntu 9.10 is only days away... and it is spectacular. Here's a quick look and what makes this the best release of any Linux distro. Ever.

item.title: [+818] Faith-Healing Parents Charged in Death of Infant Son
item.description: Edwin Lieberman, the assistant medical examiner who did Kent's autopsy, said that he had determined the manner of death to be a homicide because the boy could have been saved with basic medical care.

item.title: [+717] A Third of Dinosaur Species May Never Have Existed
item.description: Young dinosaurs weren't Mini-Me versions of their parents. New evidence suggests dino juveniles went through dramatic physical changes during their journey to adulthood. If that's the case, many fossils of young dinosaurs (including many T.rex relatives) may have been misidentified as belonging to new species.

item.title: [+710] Step Away From The Nuts!
item.description: Boba Fett wished all his bounties were so easily caught.

item.title: [+674] O'Reilly calls Richard Dawkins a fascist
item.description: Richard Dawkins responds by telling O'Reilly to stop shouting at him. Bonus points: O'Reilly claims science has never advanced the human condition.

item.title: [+563] I'm not sure how I feel about this... would this be useful?
[+552] Screw Crop Circles. Family Guy Fan Creates Awesome Field Art
item.description: Behold, a "Family Guy" corn maze... I can't imagine the amount of time and care it must have taken to create this. Not to mention, it costs this Massachusetts farmer a lot of corn.

item.title: [+501] Saudi Arabia Will Ask For Aid If We Stop Using Oil - WTF
item.description: Saudi Arabia has campaigned quietly for financial compensation should a climate deal substantially reduce the world’s use of fossil fuels.

item.title: [+474] 6 Magical Movie Items They Wasted on Bullshit
item.description: What would you do if you found a magical object that could create anything you asked for, instantly? Or a clock that could stop time? This is the type of thing that comes up in movies all the time. And for the most part, what the characters choose to do makes no freaking sense.

item.title: [+460] 'Banana Spider' Gives You a Mean Boner Before Killing You
item.description: Erections resulting from the bite are uncomfortable, can last for many hours and can lead to impotence.

item.title: [+457] Drink Coasters Can Test for Date-Rape Drugs
item.description: Drink coasters at several North Texas bars can test for substances such as GHB and ketamine.

item.title: [+437] Never underestimate the Three Wolf Moon (PIC)
item.description: If it can work for Dwight...

item.title: [+388] Study: 54% of Companies Ban Facebook, Twitter At Work
item.description: Planning on firing off a short missive on Twitter or posting an update to your friends on Facebook from the office? Better check the rules of your workplace.
